intro: Mapania purpurascens, commonly known as the purple-leaf mapania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its striking purple foliage, which contrasts with its green stems and pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
